marklogic.body: It's unfortunate, but I do think that the topic deserves attention. I'm not sure that I agree with the author and her take on parenting a healthy-weight child, but I'm not a parent. My mother was Always obsessed with her weight, and all four of her children are now obsessed with their own respective digits. Kids these days can't seem to escape unscathed. Childhood obesity is an issue with statistics that deserve attention, but I think the rhetoric involved here, and addressing the issue of youth Weight-loss is awkward. Every parent should want to raise a healthy child, and health in some sense certainly does extend to weight. But as children are incredibly vulnerable and sensitive, I'm not sure it's fair to play the vanity card, or to publicly scold them.
